com.amazon.clouddrive

Class AmazonCloudDriveClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amazon.clouddrive.AmazonCloudDriveClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AmazonCloudDrive

    public class AmazonCloudDriveClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements AmazonCloudDrive
    Client for accessing Amazon Cloud Drive. All asynchronous calls made using this client are non-blocking. Callers can either use the AsyncHandler, or use the returned Future object to check the result of the call.

                                        throws CloudDriveException,
                                               java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: AmazonCloudDrive

        Retrieves the current account's quota information from Amazon Cloud Drive. The GetAccountQuotaResponse.getQuota() and GetAccountQuotaResponse.getAvailable() are in bytes and the String contained in GetAccountQuotaResponse.getLastCalculated() is the last date and time the quota was calculated.

      • getChanges

        public GetChangesResponse getChanges(GetChangesRequest request)
                              throws CloudDriveException,
                                     java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: AmazonCloudDrive

        Retrieves a set of nodes which represent changes since a given checkpoint. If the GetChangesRequest.setCheckpoint(String) has not been called, then this request will return the earliest modified nodes. To get the next list of modified nodes, pass the checkpoint that was associated with the previous call to the request of the next call (i.e. changeRequest.setCheckpoint(String) from changes.getCheckpoint()). To retrieve all changes, keep calling this method until the GetChangesResponse.getNodes() is empty.

        Expected possible exceptions:

        • InvalidParameter
        • BadToken
        • Forbidden
        • ResourceNotFound
        • ConflictError
        • PreConditionFailure
        • TooManyRequests
        • SystemFault
        • SystemUnavailable
        • InterruptedException

        Specified by:
        getChanges in interface AmazonCloudDrive
        Parameters:
        request - Holds all possible parameters for a get changes request.
        Returns:
        Holds all values for a get changes response.
        Throws:
        CloudDriveException - A failure occurred while getting the changed nodes
        java.lang.InterruptedException - The thread was interrupted.

      • listNodes

        public ListNodesResponse listNodes(ListNodesRequest request)
                            throws CloudDriveException,
                                   java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: AmazonCloudDrive

        Lists nodes for the current account contained in Amazon Cloud Drive. Listing particular nodes is controlled by the request passed in through the parameter. The responses are paginated and particular pages can be selected from the given request.

      • createNode

        public CreateNodeResponse createNode(CreateNodeRequest request)
                              throws CloudDriveException,
                                     java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: AmazonCloudDrive

        Creates a node with the provided parameters defined in the provided PostNodeRequest. The required parameters that need to be set are:

        • EditableNodeRequest.setName(String)
        • EditableNodeRequest.setKind(String)
        An optional parameter is PostNodeRequest.getLocalId() and can be used to deduplicate node creation from a single client.

        Expected possible exceptions:

        • InvalidParameter
        • BadToken
        • Forbidden
        • ResourceNotFound
        • ConflictError
        • PreConditionFailure
        • TooManyRequests
        • SystemFault
        • SystemUnavailable
        • InterruptedException

        Specified by:
        createNode in interface AmazonCloudDrive
        Parameters:
        request - Holds all possible parameters for creating a node.
        Returns:
        The meta-data for the new node.
        Throws:
        CloudDriveException - A failure occurred while attempting to create a node or return the response from the service.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - The thread was interrupted.

      • uploadFile

        public UploadFileResponse uploadFile(UploadFileRequest request,
                            ProgressListener progressListener)
                              throws CloudDriveException,
                                     java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: AmazonCloudDrive

        Creates a file with the provided parameters defined in the provided UploadFileRequest. The required parameters that need to be set are:

        • EditableNodeRequest.setName(String)
        • EditableNodeRequest.setKind(String)
        • EditableNodeRequest.setContentProperties(com.amazon.clouddrive.model.ContentProperties), where the ContentProperties.setContentType(String) has been set.
        • UploadFileRequest.setContentLength(long). This must be greater than 0 and should be the size of the file being uploaded.
        An optional parameters are:
        • PostNodeRequest.getLocalId() and can be used to deduplicate node creation from a single client.
        • UploadFileRequest.setSuppress(com.amazon.clouddrive.model.Suppress)

        In addition to the above parameters. There is a choice between using a fixed length streaming mode or a chunked streaming mode, defined by the flag UploadFileRequest.useChunkedStreaming(). If this flag is set to true, then an other option is used to determine how big the chunks should be. Set through UploadFileRequest.setChunkSize(int). Otherwise, the system default is used. This is useful for runtime environments whose implementation of fixed streaming mode will read the stream into memory prior to sending through the network stack. In general, the default fixed streaming mode is sufficient.

        Expected possible exceptions:

        • InvalidParameter
        • BadToken
        • Forbidden
        • ResourceNotFound
        • ConflictError
        • PreConditionFailure
        • TooManyRequests
        • SystemFault
        • SystemUnavailable
        • InterruptedException

        Specified by:
        uploadFile in interface AmazonCloudDrive
        Parameters:
        request - Holds all possible parameters for uploading a file as well as the file itself.
        progressListener - Use a ProgressListener to get for the upload, or pass null if progress is not required.
        Returns:
        The meta-data for the file that was uploaded.
        Throws:
        CloudDriveException - A failure occurred while attempting to upload a file.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - The thread was interrupted.

      • addNodeProperty

        public AddNodePropertyResponse addNodeProperty(AddNodePropertyRequest request)
                                        throws CloudDriveException,
                                               java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: AmazonCloudDrive

        Adds a property for the given node. Note that there can only be 10 properties for any given owner. The required parameters that need to be set on the given request are:

        • id: The id of the node to receive the property.
        • owner: The friendly name of the application creating the property.
        • key: The key of the property being created. Maximum length 50 characters following the pattern [A-Z0-9a-z_]+
        • value: The value of the property being created. Maximum length 500 characters.

        Expected possible exceptions:

        • InvalidParameter
        • BadToken
        • Forbidden
        • ResourceNotFound
        • ConflictError
        • PreConditionFailure
        • TooManyRequests
        • SystemFault
        • SystemUnavailable
        • InterruptedException

        Specified by:
        addNodeProperty in interface AmazonCloudDrive
        Parameters:
        request - Holds all possible parameters to create a property.
        Returns:
        The added property.
        Throws:
        CloudDriveException - A failure occurred while attempting to add the given property.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - The thread was interrupted.

      • listChildren

        public ListChildrenResponse listChildren(ListChildrenRequest request)
                                  throws CloudDriveException,
                                         java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: AmazonCloudDrive

        Lists nodes which are child nodes of a given node id for the current account in Amazon Cloud Drive. The responses are paginated and particular pages can be selected from the given request. The setting of ListChildrenRequest.setId(String) is required before being passed as a parameter; otherwise, a InvalidParameter exception will be thrown.

        Expected possible exceptions:

        • InvalidParameter
        • BadToken
        • Forbidden
        • ResourceNotFound
        • ConflictError
        • PreConditionFailure

        java.lang.InterruptedException - The thread was interrupted.

      • removeChildFromParent

        public void removeChildFromParent(RemoveChildFromParentRequest request)
                           throws CloudDriveException,
                                  java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: AmazonCloudDrive

        Removes a child from its specified parent. Currently there are two different behaviors when a node will have no parents after this operation. If the node is a folder, that node will remain without any parents. If the node is a file, then that node will be deleted. The childId and parentId are required to be populated prior to giving a RemoveChildFromParentRequest to this method.

        Expected possible exceptions:

        • InvalidParameter
        • BadToken
        • Forbidden
        • ResourceNotFound
        • ConflictError
        • PreConditionFailure
        • TooManyRequests
        • SystemFault
        • SystemUnavailable
        • InterruptedException

        Specified by:
        removeChildFromParent in interface AmazonCloudDrive
        Parameters:
        request - Holds all possible parameters for removing a child from one of its parents.
        Throws:
        CloudDriveException - A failure occurred while attempting to remove a child from one of its parents.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - The thread was interrupted.

      • addChildToParent

        public void addChildToParent(AddChildToParentRequest request)
                      throws CloudDriveException,
                             java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: AmazonCloudDrive

        Adds a child from its specified parent. The childId and parentId are required to be populated prior to giving a RemoveChildFromParentRequest to this method.

      • getChangesAsync

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<GetChangesResponse> getChangesAsync(GetChangesRequest request,
                                                              AsyncHandler<GetChangesRequest,GetChangesResponse> asyncHandler)
        Description copied from interface: AmazonCloudDrive

        Retrieves a set of nodes which represent changes since a given checkpoint. If the GetChangesRequest.setCheckpoint(String) has not been called, then this request will return the earliest modified nodes. To get the next list of modified nodes, pass the checkpoint that was associated with the previous call to the request of the next call (i.e. changeRequest.setCheckpoint(String) from changes.getCheckpoint()). To retrieve all changes, keep calling this method until the GetChangesResponse.getNodes() is empty.

        Expected possible exceptions on AsyncHandler.onError(com.amazon.clouddrive.model.CloudDriveRequest, Exception)

        • InvalidParameter
        • BadToken
        • Forbidden
        • ResourceNotFound
        • ConflictError
        • PreConditionFailure
        • TooManyRequests
        • SystemFault
        • SystemUnavailable

        Specified by:
        getChangesAsync in interface AmazonCloudDrive
        Parameters:
        request - Holds all possible parameters for a get changes request.
        Returns:
        A Future to Changes which defines how to retrieve the list of nodes associated with a given checkpoint.

      • createNodeAsync

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<CreateNodeResponse> createNodeAsync(CreateNodeRequest request,
                                                              AsyncHandler<CreateNodeRequest,CreateNodeResponse> asyncHandler)
        Description copied from interface: AmazonCloudDrive

        Creates a node with the provided parameters defined in the provided PostNodeRequest. The required parameters that need to be set are:

        • EditableNodeRequest.setName(String)
        • EditableNodeRequest.setKind(String)
        An optional parameter is PostNodeRequest.getLocalId() and can be used to deduplicate node creation from a single client.

        Expected possible exceptions on AsyncHandler.onError(com.amazon.clouddrive.model.CloudDriveRequest, Exception)

      • uploadFileAsync

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<UploadFileResponse> uploadFileAsync(UploadFileRequest request,
                                                              ProgressListener progressListener,
                                                              AsyncHandler<UploadFileRequest,UploadFileResponse> asyncHandler)
        Description copied from interface: AmazonCloudDrive

        Creates a file with the provided parameters defined in the provided UploadFileRequest. The required parameters that need to be set are:

        • EditableNodeRequest.setName(String)
        • EditableNodeRequest.setKind(String)
        • EditableNodeRequest.setContentProperties(com.amazon.clouddrive.model.ContentProperties), where the ContentProperties.setContentType(String) has been set.
        • UploadFileRequest.setContentLength(long). This must be greater than 0 and should be the size of the file being uploaded.
        An optional parameters are:
        • PostNodeRequest.getLocalId() and can be used to deduplicate node creation from a single client.
        • UploadFileRequest.setSuppress(com.amazon.clouddrive.model.Suppress)

        In addition to the above parameters. There is a choice between using a fixed length streaming mode or a chunked streaming mode, defined by the flag UploadFileRequest.useChunkedStreaming(). If this flag is set to true, then an other option is used to determine how big the chunks should be. Set through UploadFileRequest.setChunkSize(int). Otherwise, the system default is used. This is useful for runtime environments whose implementation of fixed streaming mode will read the stream into memory prior to sending through the network stack. In general, the default fixed streaming mode is sufficient.

        Expected possible exceptions on AsyncHandler.onError(com.amazon.clouddrive.model.CloudDriveRequest, Exception)

        • InvalidParameter
        • BadToken
        • Forbidden
        • ResourceNotFound
        • ConflictError
        • PreConditionFailure
        • TooManyRequests
        • SystemFault
        • SystemUnavailable

        Specified by:
        uploadFileAsync in interface AmazonCloudDrive
        Parameters:
        request - Holds all possible parameters for uploading a file as well as the file itself.
        progressListener - Use a ProgressListener to get for the upload, or pass null if progress is not required.
        Returns:
        A Future to NodeInfoResponse which contains meta-data for the file that was uploaded.

      • addNodePropertyAsync

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<AddNodePropertyResponse> addNodePropertyAsync(AddNodePropertyRequest request,
                                                                        AsyncHandler<AddNodePropertyRequest,AddNodePropertyResponse> asyncHandler)
        Description copied from interface: AmazonCloudDrive

        Adds a property for the given node. Note that there can only be 10 properties for any given owner. The required parameters that need to be set on the given request are:

        • id: The id of the node to receive the property.
        • owner: The friendly name of the application creating the property.
        • key: The key of the property being created. Maximum length 50 characters following the pattern [A-Z0-9a-z_]+
        • value: The value of the property being created. Maximum length 500 characters.

        Expected possible exceptions on AsyncHandler.onError(com.amazon.clouddrive.model.CloudDriveRequest, Exception)

        • InvalidParameter
        • BadToken
        • Forbidden
        • ResourceNotFound
        • ConflictError
        • PreConditionFailure
        • TooManyRequests
        • SystemFault
        • SystemUnavailable

        Specified by:
        addNodePropertyAsync in interface AmazonCloudDrive
        Parameters:
        request - Holds all possible parameters to create a property.
        Returns:
        A Future to AddPropertyResponse which is the The added property.

      • removeChildFromParentAsync

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Void> removeChildFromParentAsync(RemoveChildFromParentRequest request,
                                                                     AsyncHandler<RemoveChildFromParentRequest,java.lang.Void> asyncHandler)
        Description copied from interface: AmazonCloudDrive

        Removes a child from its specified parent. Currently there are two different behaviors when a node will have no parents after this operation. If the node is a folder, that node will remain without any parents. If the node is a file, then that node will be deleted. The childId and parentId are required to be populated prior to giving a RemoveChildFromParentRequest to this method.

        Expected possible exceptions:

        • InvalidParameter
        • BadToken
        • Forbidden
        • ResourceNotFound
        • ConflictError
        • PreConditionFailure
        • TooManyRequests
        • SystemFault
        • SystemUnavailable

        Specified by:
        removeChildFromParentAsync in interface AmazonCloudDrive
        Parameters:
        request - Holds all possible parameters for removing a child from one of its parents.
        Returns:
        A Future to Void
